intro: Anchusa ochroleuca, commonly known as the white hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with similar characteristics. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers, which are clustered in a flat-topped inflorescence. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it typically grows in dry, open habitats. Anchusa ochroleuca is often found in meadows, roadsides, and other disturbed areas, where it thrives in full sun.
